009package imagingbook.spectral.fd;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Complex;
017
018
019/**
020 * Subclass of FourierDescriptor whose constructors assume
021 * that input polygons are uniformly sampled.
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2020/04/01
025 */
026public class FourierDescriptorUniform extends FourierDescriptor {
027        
028        /**
029         * Creates a new Fourier descriptor from a uniformly sampled polygon V
030         * with the maximum number of Fourier coefficient pairs.
031         * 
032         * @param V polygon
033         */
034        public FourierDescriptorUniform(Pnt2d[] V) {
035                g = makeComplex(V);
036                G = DFT(g);
037        }
038        
039        
040        /**
041         * Creates a new Fourier descriptor from a uniformly sampled polygon V
042         * with Mp coefficient pairs.
043         * 
044         * @param V polygon
045         * @param Mp number of coefficient pairs
046         */
047        public FourierDescriptorUniform(Pnt2d[] V, int Mp) {
048                g = makeComplex(V);
049                G = DFT(g, 2 * Mp + 1);
050        }
051        
052        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
053        
054
055        /**
056         * DFT with the resulting spectrum (signal, if inverse) of the same length
057         * as the input vector g. Not using sin/cos tables.
058         * 
059         * @param g signal vector
060         * @return DFT spectrum
061         */
062        private Complex[] DFT(Complex[] g) {
063                int M = g.length;
064//              double[] cosTable = makeCosTable(M);    // cosTable[m] == cos(2*pi*m/M)
065//              double[] sinTable = makeSinTable(M);
066                Complex[] G = new Complex[M];
067                double s = 1.0 / M; //common scale factor (fwd/inverse differ!)
068                for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
069                        double Am = 0;
070                        double Bm = 0;
071                        for (int k = 0; k < M; k++) {
072                                double x = g[k].re;
073                                double y = g[k].im;
074                                double phi = 2 * Math.PI * m * k / M;
075                                double cosPhi = Math.cos(phi);
076                                double sinPhi = Math.sin(phi);
077                                Am = Am + x * cosPhi + y * sinPhi;
078                                Bm = Bm - x * sinPhi + y * cosPhi;
079                        }
080                        G[m] = new Complex(s * Am, s * Bm);
081                }
082                return G;
083        }
084        
085
086        /**
087         * As above, but the length P of the resulting spectrum (signal, if inverse) 
088         * is explicitly specified.
089         * @param g signal vector
090         * @param MM length of the resulting  DFT spectrum
091         * @return DFT spectrum
092         */
093        private Complex[] DFT(Complex[] g, int MM) {
094                int M = g.length;
095                if (MM > M) {
096                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("truncated spectrum must be shorter than original MM=" + MM);
097                }
098//              double[] cosTable = makeCosTable(M);    // cosTable[m] == cos(2*pi*m/M)
099//              double[] sinTable = makeSinTable(M);
100                Complex[] G = new Complex[MM];
101                double s = 1.0/M; //common scale factor (fwd/inverse differ!)
102                
103//              for (int j = Mp/2-Mp+1; j <= Mp/2; j++) {
104                for (int j = -MM/2; j <= (MM-1)/2; j++) {
105                        double Am = 0;
106                        double Bm = 0;
107                        for (int k = 0; k < M; k++) {
108                                double x = g[k].re;
109                                double y = g[k].im;
110                                //int mk = (m * k) % M; double phi = 2 * Math.PI * mk / M;
111                                double phi = 2 * Math.PI * j * k / M;   
112                                double cosPhi = Math.cos(phi);
113                                double sinPhi = Math.sin(phi);
114                                Am = Am + x * cosPhi + y * sinPhi;
115                                Bm = Bm - x * sinPhi + y * cosPhi;
116                        }
117                        G[Arithmetic.mod(j, MM)] = new Complex(s * Am, s * Bm);
118                }
119                return G;
120        }
121
122//      private double[] makeCosTable(int M) {
123//              double[] cosTab = new double[M];
124//              for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
125//                      cosTab[m] = Math.cos(2 * Math.PI * m / M);
126//              }
127//              return cosTab;
128//      }
129
130//      private double[] makeSinTable(int M) {
131//              double[] sinTab = new double[M];
132//              for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
133//                      sinTab[m] = Math.sin(2 * Math.PI * m / M);
134//              }
135//              return sinTab;
136//      }
137        
138        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
139        
140        public static void main(String[] args) {
141                double[][] points = {{3,2}, {5,4}, {7,10}, {6,11}, {4, 7}};
142
143                Pnt2d[] V = PntUtils.fromDoubleArray(points);
144                
145                FourierDescriptorUniform fd1 = new FourierDescriptorUniform(V); 
146                System.out.println(Arrays.toString(fd1.getCoefficients()));
147                
148                FourierDescriptorUniform fd2 = new FourierDescriptorUniform(V, 2); 
149                System.out.println(Arrays.toString(fd2.getCoefficients()));
150                
151                
152        }
153        
154
155}
